Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Missile weapon (?)
Description: Semi-circular object with a perforation at each extremity and a groove along the longest side.  Examples of all sizes exist, most of them made from terracotta, found in large numbers in Nubian fortresses. It is unknown whether they are missile weapons, loom weights or weights for fishing nets as there are no wear marks on any of them.
